review: I have a media player and really get tired of trying to type one letter at a time searching for something on Youtube.  With this I can search comfortably from my chair. author: Dixon Cayne

review: The chromecast offers a simple easy-to-install streaming option for home media centers. I use my Chromecast in conjunction with my FreeNAS server and Plex Media Server (plugin for FreeNAS). The chromecast works great and has handled all my x264 encoded library with ease.My only complaint is that the current Chromecast does not support AC wireless bands (higher frequency ... aka faster) WiFi. The chromecast requires the use of a phone, tablet, or computer to cast media or control content playback. If you are used to a old fashion remote, then go for a Roku, FireTV, or something else.Overall the chromecast is worth the buy and comes highly recommended.
author: Nathan

review: This works great with plex and their app and its integration in Android. You can pretty much share from any app in Android with Plex, and then watch that on chromecast (great job Plex team!). But I feel there isn't that much integration in Google's android ecosystem (Google...you made this, not Plex, what's with the lack of integration!?). I have to bend over backwards to get it to work, and most of that means using Plex's integration to Android to get content over to chromecast.The biggest issue for me is that it's networking is very stupid. I have a couple routers setup at opposite ends of my house. They both have the same name. Chromecast, which is situated at one of the ends of the house, wants to always connect to the WORST signal router at the opposite side. This caused me to have to rename my routers. VERY dumb.
author: M. Diehl

review: This simple little media feeder works GREAT for me. im hardly ever home and this allowed me to totally replace my cable box and watch media through my internet provider. It seamlessly links any droid, Google chrome browser and tablet to play youtube, google music. just about anything. they also allow aftermarket programs to feed movies to It as well. best 35 bucks ive spent for my home.
